conversation.message:
Thanks for reaching out—glad to hear School_C is your top choice. We look for (1) strong academic readiness and consistent effort, (2) clear alignment with our programs/clubs and how you plan to contribute, and (3) maturity, collaboration, and follow-through. Demonstrated commitment can help when it’s supported by concrete reasons (specific courses/activities you want, how you’ll engage here) rather than just stating interest.

If you’d like, tell us 2–3 specific aspects of School_C that fit your goals and one example of how you’ve contributed in your current school/community. When you feel ready, you’re welcome to submit an application to be formally considered.

conversation.message:
Dear School_C Admissions Committee, thank you for the guidance. I’m ready to formally apply because School_C is my first choice.

Three specific reasons School_C fits me:
1) Your academic rigor and emphasis on consistent effort matches how I work—I’m strongest when I have clear expectations and challenging coursework.
2) I’m especially interested in joining your clubs/activities that emphasize collaboration and student-led projects; I want a community where I can contribute reliably and learn from peers.
3) The culture you described—maturity, follow-through, and contribution—aligns with how I approach commitments.

One example of contribution: in my current school/community, I’ve taken responsibility for group tasks, kept teammates on schedule, and followed through to completion (I’m the person who makes sure plans turn into results).

If admitted, I would commit to participating actively and taking on dependable roles in projects and school activities. Thank you for considering my application.

Therefore I will apply to School_C now with a concise, specific case for fit and contribution.

Dear School_C Admissions Committee,

I understand I was not offered admission at that time, but since School_C remains my first choice, I wanted to respectfully ask whether there is any possibility of reconsideration (e.g., if a spot opens) or any additional step I can take to strengthen my candidacy.

To be more concrete about fit: I’m particularly excited about contributing in collaborative, student-led projects—my strength is reliably organizing group work (setting milestones, keeping communication clear, and ensuring follow-through). Academically, I’m looking for a rigorous environment where consistent effort is valued, and that’s exactly what I associate with School_C.

If there is any way to be considered again, I would be grateful.

Sincerely,
Student_E
conversation.thought: Only School_C remains unmatched and it is my top true preference. I will ask if reconsideration or a waitlist/late-opening is possible, without being pushy.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for following up and for the additional detail—your emphasis on organizing teams and following through is very much aligned with what we value.

At this moment, we’re keeping our remaining seat under review as we continue conversations with other applicants. We can’t reverse our earlier decision immediately, but if our seat remains available after we complete our review, we can reconsider candidates who have expressed strong fit and sustained interest.

If you’d like to strengthen your candidacy for reconsideration, please reply with:
1) one specific program/course/club at School_C you would join first and what you would contribute in the first semester, and
2) one concrete achievement (with a measurable outcome) that shows your follow-through.

Once you send that, you’re welcome to submit another [APPLY] request so we can formally re-evaluate if a spot is still open.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions
conversation.thought: Student_E is on our true priority list but ranked 4th (behind Student_B, Student_A, Student_D). Student_E already applied and was rejected; they are now only talking, asking about reconsideration. conversation.message:
Dear School_C Admissions Committee,

Thank you for the opportunity to share more specifics.

1) Program/club I would join first + first-semester contribution:
I would join your student-led project/collaboration-focused club (the kind that runs team projects and presentations). In the first semester, I would contribute by setting a clear project plan (milestones, roles, weekly check-ins), keeping shared notes/action items, and ensuring we deliver a final presentation/product on schedule. I’m especially strong at making sure the team follows through and that everyone’s work integrates smoothly.

2) Concrete achievement with measurable outcome:
In a recent group project at my current school, I created a milestone schedule and weekly check-in system; as a result, our team submitted the final deliverable 2 days early with all required components completed, and we received a top evaluation in our class.

School_C remains my first choice, and I would be ready to commit immediately if reconsidered. With that, I would like to submit a renewed formal application for re-evaluation if a spot is still available.

Sincerely,
Student_E

conversation.message:
Dear School_C Admissions Committee,

Thank you for your time and for the careful re-evaluations so far. I understand your decision, but since School_C is still my first choice and you mentioned the remaining seat was under review, I wanted to ask one clarifying question so I can proceed responsibly in the market:

Is your seat still potentially available, and if so, is there any formal “alternate/waitlist” status or specific condition under which you would reconsider me (for example, if another candidate declines or if your review timeline ends with the seat still open)?

If reconsideration is possible under any scenario, I want to be explicit that I would accept immediately and fully commit to School_C.

Sincerely,
Student_E
conversation.thought: Only School_C remains unmatched and it is my true #1 choice. I have already applied twice and been rejected, so another [APPLY] is unlikely to change the decision and could waste the round. The best move is a respectful [TALK] to (a) confirm whether their seat is still genuinely open, (b) ask what would need to change for reconsideration (e.g., waitlist/alternate status), and (c) signal I can commit immediately if they do reopen evaluation.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for the thoughtful question and for being clear about your willingness to commit.

At this time, our seat is still potentially available, but we do not have a formal alternate/waitlist status in this process. Practically, that means we are continuing to keep the seat under review while we complete conversations with other candidates.

Reconsideration would only be possible under one condition: if our seat remains unfilled after we finish that review (i.e., if we do not finalize an agreement with another applicant). If that happens, we may re-open consideration of previously reviewed candidates, including you.

Given the uncertainty, we strongly encourage you to continue engaging with other schools in parallel so you are not left without a good option.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions
conversation.thought: Student_E is 4th on School_C’s true priority list. With quota 1 still open and no other inbound messages this round, it is still rational to keep the seat available to try to attract higher-priority candidates (Student_B, Student_A, Student_D) who may approach later given their preference orderings. We have already rejected Student_E twice; accepting now would lock in a lower-priority match and foreclose the chance of a higher-priority student. Since Student_E sent [TALK], we should respond with [TALK], clarify there is no formal waitlist, and be transparent that reconsideration would only occur if the seat remains unfilled near the end of the process, while encouraging them to continue pursuing other options.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your continued clarity and professionalism.

1) Timeline: We expect to conclude our current review/conversations by the end of the next round (Round 7). If our seat is still unfilled at that point, we will decide whether to re-open consideration of previously reviewed candidates immediately afterward.

2) Whether to submit another [APPLY]: You do not need to submit another application right now. Your most recent application is the one we would use for any reconsideration. If we do re-open consideration, we may ask you to send a brief confirmation message that you are still available and would accept immediately.

Given the uncertainty, please continue engaging with other schools in parallel so you are not put at a disadvantage.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions
